body.p: Shows the status of a running Greenplum Database system.

section.title: Description
section.p: The gpstate utility displays information about a running Greenplum Database instance. There is additional information you may want to know about a Greenplum Database system, since it is comprised of multiple PostgreSQL database instances (segments) spanning multiple machines. The gpstate utility provides additional status information for a Greenplum Database system, such as:

ul.li: Coordinator and segment configuration information (hosts, data directories, etc.).
The ports used by the system.
A mapping of primary segments to their corresponding mirror segments.

plentry.pd: Optional. Display a brief summary of the state of the Greenplum Database system. This is the default option.
The number of segments to check in parallel. If not specified, the utility will start up to 60 parallel processes depending on how many segment instances it needs to check.
Optional. Display mapping of primary segments to their corresponding mirror segments.
Optional. The coordinator data directory. If not specified, the value set for $COORDINATOR_DATA_DIRECTORY will be used.

pd.p: Show details on primary/mirror segment pairs that have potential issues. These issues include:

ul.li: Whether any primary-mirror segment pairs are out of sync – including information on how many bytes are remaining to sync (as displayed in the WAL sync remaining bytes output field). gpstate -e does not display segment pairs that are in sync.
Whether any primary-mirror segment pairs are not in their preferred roles.

plentry.pd: Display details of the standby coordinator host if configured.
Display the Greenplum Database software version information for each instance.
The directory to write the log file. Defaults to ~/gpAdminLogs.
Optional. List the mirror segment instances in the system and their current role.
List the port numbers used throughout the Greenplum Database system.
Optional. Run in quiet mode. Except for warning messages, command output is not displayed on the screen. However, this information is still written to the log file.
Optional. Checks segment status in the system catalog on the coordinator host. Does not poll the segments for status.
Optional. Displays detailed status information about the Greenplum Database system.
Optional. Displays error messages and outputs detailed status and progress information.
Optional. Displays detailed information about the progress and state of a Greenplum system expansion.

section.title: Output Field Definitions
section.p: The following output fields are reported by gpstate -s for the coordinator:

table.title: gpstate output data for the coordinator

row.entry: PID of the coordinator database listener process
file system location of the coordinator data directory
port of the coordinator postgres database listener process

dispatch = regular operating mode
utility = maintenance mode

Standard = one NIC per host
Multi-Home = multiple NICs per host
version of Greenplum Database when system was first initialized
version of PostgreSQL that Greenplum Database is based on
host name of the standby coordinator
status of the standby coordinator: active or passive

section.p: The following output fields are reported by gpstate -s for each primary segment:

table.title: gpstate -s output data for primary segments

row.entry: file system location of segment data directory
port number of segment postgres database listener process
current role of a segment: Mirror or Primary
role at system initialization time: Mirror or Primary

status of a primary/mirror segment pair:
Synchronized = data is up to date on both
Not in Sync = the mirror segment has not caught up to the primary segment
Location where primary segment is writing new logs as they come in
Bytes remaining to send to mirror
Bytes remaining to be sent from primary to mirror
active process ID of a segment
segment status as reported in the system catalog: Up or Down
status of Greenplum Database to incoming requests: Up, Down, or Suspended. A Suspended state means database activity is temporarily paused while a segment transitions from one state to another.

section.p: The following output fields are reported by gpstate -s for each mirror segment:

table.title: gpstate -s output data for mirror segments

row.entry: file system location of segment data directory
port number of segment postgres database listener process
current role of a segment: Mirror or Primary
role at system initialization time: Mirror or Primary

status of a primary/mirror segment pair:
Synchronized = data is up to date on both
Not in Sync = the mirror segment has not caught up to the primary segment
Log location up to which the primary segment has sent log data to the mirror
Log location up to which the mirror segment has flushed the log data to disk
Log location up to which the mirror segment has replayed logs locally
Bytes received but remain to flush
Difference between flush log location and sent log location
Bytes received but remain to replay
Difference between replay log location and sent log location
active process ID of a segment
segment status as reported in the system catalog: Up or Down
status of Greenplum Database to incoming requests: Up, Down, or Suspended. A Suspended state means database activity is temporarily paused while a segment transitions from one state to another.

section.note:
When there is no connection between a primary segment and its mirror, gpstate -s displays Unknown in the following fields:
Bytes remaining to send to mirror
WAL Sent Location
WAL Flush Location
WAL Replay Location
Bytes received but remain to flush
Bytes received but remain to replay
section.p: The following output fields are reported by gpstate -f for standby coordinator replication status:

table.title: gpstate output data for coordinator replication

row.entry: file system location of the standby coordinator data directory
port of the standby coordinator postgres database listener process
process ID of the standby coordinator
status of the standby coordinator: Standby host passive
write-ahead log (WAL) streaming state: streaming, startup,backup, catchup
WAL sender transaction log (xlog) record sent location
WAL receiver xlog record flush location
